verses.roman:
prabhu-sparśe duḥkha-saṅge kuṣṭha dūre gela
ānanda sahite aṅga sundara ha-ila

synonyms: prabhu-sparśe—by the touch of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; duḥkha-saṅge—along with his unhappiness; kuṣṭha—the infection of leprosy; dūre—to a distant place; gela—went; ānanda sahite—with great pleasure; aṅga—whole body; sundara—beautiful; ha-ila—became.
translation: When Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu touched him, both the leprosy and his distress went to a distant place. Indeed, Vāsudeva's body became very beautiful, to his great happiness.
